trans-unit.source: About StorSimple device modes
trans-unit.target: About StorSimple device modes

trans-unit.source: Your StorSimple device can operate in normal, maintenance, or recovery mode.
trans-unit.target: Your StorSimple device can operate in normal, maintenance, or recovery mode.

trans-unit.source: Each of these modes is briefly described below.
trans-unit.target: Each of these modes is briefly described below.

trans-unit.source: Normal mode
trans-unit.target: Normal mode

trans-unit.source: This is defined as the normal operational mode for a fully configured StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: This is defined as the normal operational mode for a fully configured StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: By default, your device should be in normal mode.
trans-unit.target: By default, your device should be in normal mode.

trans-unit.source: Maintenance mode
trans-unit.target: Maintenance mode

trans-unit.source: Sometimes the StorSimple device may need to be placed into maintenance mode.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes the StorSimple device may need to be placed into maintenance mode.

trans-unit.source: This mode allows you to perform maintenance on the device and install disruptive updates, such as those related to disk firmware.
trans-unit.target: This mode allows you to perform maintenance on the device and install disruptive updates, such as those related to disk firmware.

trans-unit.source: You can put the system into maintenance mode only via the Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: You can put the system into maintenance mode only via the Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: All I/O requests are paused in this mode.
trans-unit.target: All I/O requests are paused in this mode.

trans-unit.source: Services such as non-volatile random access memory (NVRAM) or the clustering service are also stopped.
trans-unit.target: Services such as non-volatile random access memory (NVRAM) or the clustering service are also stopped.

trans-unit.source: Both the controllers are rebooted when you enter or exit this mode.
trans-unit.target: Both the controllers are rebooted when you enter or exit this mode.

trans-unit.source: When you exit the maintenance mode, all the services will resume and should be healthy.
trans-unit.target: When you exit the maintenance mode, all the services will resume and should be healthy.

trans-unit.source: This may take a few minutes.
trans-unit.target: This may take a few minutes.

trans-unit.source: Maintenance mode is only supported on a properly functioning device.
trans-unit.target: Maintenance mode is only supported on a properly functioning device.

trans-unit.source: It is not supported on a device in which one or both of the controllers are not functioning.
trans-unit.target: It is not supported on a device in which one or both of the controllers are not functioning.

trans-unit.source: Recovery mode
trans-unit.target: Recovery mode

trans-unit.source: Recovery mode can be described as "Windows Safe Mode with network support".
trans-unit.target: Recovery mode can be described as "Windows Safe Mode with network support".

trans-unit.source: Recovery mode engages the Microsoft Support team and allows them to perform diagnostics on the system.
trans-unit.target: Recovery mode engages the Microsoft Support team and allows them to perform diagnostics on the system.

trans-unit.source: The primary goal of recovery mode is to retrieve the system logs.
trans-unit.target: The primary goal of recovery mode is to retrieve the system logs.

trans-unit.source: If your system goes into recovery mode, you should contact Microsoft Support for next steps.
trans-unit.target: If your system goes into recovery mode, you should contact Microsoft Support for next steps.

trans-unit.source: For more information, go to [Contact Microsoft Support](storsimple-contact-microsoft-support.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, go to [Contact Microsoft Support](storsimple-contact-microsoft-support.md).

trans-unit.source: You cannot place the device in recovery mode.
trans-unit.target: You cannot place the device in recovery mode.

trans-unit.source: If the device is in a bad state, recovery mode tries to get the device into a state in which Microsoft Support personnel can examine it.
trans-unit.target: If the device is in a bad state, recovery mode tries to get the device into a state in which Microsoft Support personnel can examine it.

trans-unit.source: Determine StorSimple device mode
trans-unit.target: Determine StorSimple device mode

trans-unit.source: To determine the current device mode
trans-unit.target: To determine the current device mode

trans-unit.source: Log on to the device serial console by following the steps in [Use PuTTY to connect to the device serial console](storsimple-deployment-walkthrough.md#use-putty-to-connect-to-the-device-serial-console).
trans-unit.target: Log on to the device serial console by following the steps in [Use PuTTY to connect to the device serial console](storsimple-deployment-walkthrough.md#use-putty-to-connect-to-the-device-serial-console).

trans-unit.source: Look at the banner message in the serial console menu of the device.
trans-unit.target: Look at the banner message in the serial console menu of the device.

trans-unit.source: This message explicitly indicates whether the device is in maintenance or recovery mode.
trans-unit.target: This message explicitly indicates whether the device is in maintenance or recovery mode.

trans-unit.source: If the message does not contain any specific information pertaining to the system mode, the device is in normal mode.
trans-unit.target: If the message does not contain any specific information pertaining to the system mode, the device is in normal mode.

trans-unit.source: Change the StorSimple device mode
trans-unit.target: Change the StorSimple device mode

trans-unit.source: You can place the StorSimple device into maintenance mode (from normal mode) to perform maintenance or install maintenance mode updates.
trans-unit.target: You can place the StorSimple device into maintenance mode (from normal mode) to perform maintenance or install maintenance mode updates.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following procedures to enter or exit maintenance mode.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following procedures to enter or exit maintenance mode.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Before entering maintenance mode, verify that both device controllers are healthy by accessing the **Hardware Status** on the **Maintenance** page in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Before entering maintenance mode, verify that both device controllers are healthy by accessing the **Hardware Status** on the **Maintenance** page in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: If the controller is not healthy, contact Microsoft Support for the next steps.
trans-unit.target: If the controller is not healthy, contact Microsoft Support for the next steps.

trans-unit.source: For more information, go to [Contact Microsoft Support](storsimple-contact-microsoft-support.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, go to [Contact Microsoft Support](storsimple-contact-microsoft-support.md).

trans-unit.target: In the serial console menu, choose option 1, **Log in with full access**.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, provide the **device administrator password**.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, provide the **device administrator password**.

trans-unit.source: The default password is: `Password1`.
trans-unit.target: The default password is: `Password1`.
